  • View page source

ciss_vae.utils.matrix.create_missingness_prop_matrix

create_missingness_prop_matrix(data, index_col=None, cols_ignore=None, na_values=None, repeat_feature_names=None)[source]

Create a missingness proportion matrix summarizing feature-level missingness per sample.

Computes the proportion of missing values for each feature within each sample, optionally accounting for repeated measurements of the same feature (e.g., across timepoints). This matrix can be used for downstream clustering on missingness patterns (e.g., via cluster_on_missing_prop()).

Parameters:

  • data (pandas.DataFrame or numpy.ndarray) – Input dataset containing features that may include missing values. Must be coercible to a pandas DataFrame.

  • index_col (str or None, optional) – Name of the column to treat as the sample index. This column is excluded from missingness calculations but preserved in the output metadata. Defaults to None.

  • cols_ignore (list[str] or None, optional) – List of column names to exclude from missingness calculations (e.g., identifiers, non-feature columns). Defaults to None.

  • na_values (list[Any] or None, optional) – Additional values to treat as missing beyond standard NaN and None. Defaults to [NA, NaN, Inf, -Inf] if None is provided.

  • repeat_feature_names (list[str] or None, optional) – Optional list of feature base names for features with repeated timepoints. Repeat measurements must follow the pattern <feature>_<timepoint> where <timepoint> is an integer. The function will aggregate missingness across all timepoints for each listed feature. Defaults to None.

Returns:

A MissingnessMatrix object containing: - data (numpy.ndarray): Matrix of missingness proportions, shape (n_samples, n_features). - feature_columns_map (dict): Mapping of base feature names to column indices. - to_dataframe() (pandas.DataFrame): Method to convert to a DataFrame.

Return type:

MissingnessMatrix

Example:

>>> prop_matrix = create_missingness_prop_matrix(
...     data=df,
...     index_col="patient_id",
...     cols_ignore=["study_site"],
...     repeat_feature_names=["ALT", "AST", "Bilirubin"]
... )
>>> prop_matrix.data.shape
(150, 12)
>>> prop_matrix.to_dataframe().head()
     ALT  AST  Bilirubin  ...
patient_01  0.00  0.25  0.10  ...
